title: Identify unintended consequences
body: Now that you understand the case study, it's time to identify unintended consequences. Please enter a consequence in the provided text box. If you have multiple consequences to add, simply click the '+' button to add additional entries.
instruction: Input every consequence in a box below, clicking the '+' sign to add a new consequence
ariaQuestion: Question text specifically for screen readers.

_feedback.title: Feedback
_feedback.correct: This feedback will appear if you answered the question correctly.

_incorrect.final: This feedback will appear if you answered the question incorrectly.

_partlyCorrect.final: This feedback will appear if you answered part of the question correctly.

_comment: You only need to include _buttons if you want to override the button labels that are set in course.json

title: Scenario Selection and Exploration
body: Imagine you're discussing data ethics with an expert. They present three scenarios, each with its own ethical concerns. Your first task is to choose one scenario that captures your interest. Understand the case study and it's objectives.
instruction: Remember:Â You can always choose to select a different secenario.

_items.text: What scenario would you be interested in conducting your analysis on?

A popular social media platform has been collecting vast amounts of user data, including personal information, browsing habits, and location data. They use this data to personalize advertisements and content for users, creating a more engaging experience. However, concerns have been raised about the potential misuse of this data, such as targeted manipulation of user behavior, invasion of privacy, and the creation of filter bubbles that reinforce existing beliefs.

_options.text: Tell me about the objective behind Scenario 1

_items.text: Case Study: A company is developing self-driving cars with advanced AI systems that make real-time decisions on the road. These cars are designed to minimize accidents, reduce traffic congestion, and provide a convenient mode of transportation. However, questions have arisen regarding the ethical decisions the AI might face in potential accident scenarios, where the car must choose between protecting its passengers or pedestrians.

_options.text: Tell me about the objective behind Scenario 2

_items.text: A medical research consortium aims to accelerate scientific discoveries by sharing patient health data across various institutions. This collaboration allows researchers to analyze a large and diverse dataset, leading to potentially groundbreaking medical advancements. However, concerns exist regarding patient privacy, data security, and the potential misuse of sensitive health information.

_options.text: Tell me about the objective behind Scenario 3

_items.id: Tell me about the objective behind Scenario 1
_items.text: The creators aim to provide users with a tailored and engaging social media experience while maximizing ad revenue through data-driven advertising.

_options.text: I understand, now I would like to begin my analysis

_items.id: Tell me about the objective behind Scenario 2
_items.text: The creators intend to create safer, more efficient transportation options using autonomous vehicles, improving road safety and reducing congestion.

_options.text: I understand, I would know like to conduct my analysis

_items.id: Tell me about the objective behind Scenario 3
_items.text: The creators seek to advance medical research by facilitating the exchange of patient data among research institutions, enabling more comprehensive studies and accelerating discoveries.

_options.text: I understand, now I would like to conduct my analysis

title: Categorise the consequences
body:
In the final part of this exercise, you'll categorise the consequences you've identified into two groups:

  • Identify which of the positive consequences they believe should be focused on
  • Identify which consequences should be mitigated
instruction: Drag and drop each bullet point to the appropriate category on the board.

_feedback.title: Take a look below at our sample answers.
_feedback.correct:
Certainly, here's a concise list of possible consequences for the given case study:

Consequences to be Mitigated:

  • Ethical dilemmas: AI choosing between passenger and pedestrian safety raises moral concerns.
  • Public trust: Controversial decisions might reduce trust in autonomous vehicles.
  • Legal complexities: Accidents could lead to complex legal and liability issues.
  • Bias perception: Decisions favoring one group could lead to bias perception concerns.

Positive Consequences:

  • Reduced accidents: AI-driven decisions could significantly decrease human error accidents.
  • Traffic flow: Communication between autonomous vehicles could ease traffic congestion.
  • Accessibility: Non-drivers gain mobility and independence with self-driving cars.
  • Environmental impact: Efficient routing could lead to reduced emissions.

_incorrect.final:
Certainly, here's a concise list of possible consequences for the given case study:

Consequences to be Mitigated:

  • Ethical dilemmas: AI choosing between passenger and pedestrian safety raises moral concerns.
  • Public trust: Controversial decisions might reduce trust in autonomous vehicles.
  • Legal complexities: Accidents could lead to complex legal and liability issues.
  • Bias perception: Decisions favoring one group could lead to bias perception concerns.

Positive Consequences:

  • Reduced accidents: AI-driven decisions could significantly decrease human error accidents.
  • Traffic flow: Communication between autonomous vehicles could ease traffic congestion.
  • Accessibility: Non-drivers gain mobility and independence with self-driving cars.
  • Environmental impact: Efficient routing could lead to reduced emissions.

title: Consequence scanning
body: Welcome to the Consequence Scanning module. In this exercise, you will explore the complex world of data ethics by using a consequence scanner. Your goal is to develop a deeper understanding of the consequences of ethical decision-making in data and technology.

title: Summary
body: Congratulations on navigating through this exercise! Remember, the purpose isn't to reach definitive conclusions, but to practice consequence scanning, critical thinking, and ethical reasoning.

title: LO's
body:
By the end of this module, you will be able to:

  • Understand the importance of data ethics and its real-world implications.
  • Identify potential positive and negative outcomes in ethical dilemmas using consequence scanning.
  • Analyze the consequences of specific actions within a given data ethics case study.
  • Develop strategies to mitigate negative consequences and enhance positive impacts.
  • Engage in meaningful discussions about ethical considerations and consequences in data contexts.
